metadata.title: CVE-2019-9721 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service in the subtitle decoder in FFmpeg 3.2 and 4.1 allowsattackers to hog the CPU via a crafted video file in Matroska format,because handle_open_brace in libavcodec/htmlsubtitles.c has a complexformat argument to sscanf.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
